Knievel's most famous stunt was his attempt to jump over the Snake River Canyon in Idaho on a 75-foot motorcycle, known as the "Jump." The event took place on September 8, 1974, and although the jump ended in failure, it solidified Knievel's status as an American cultural icon. Knievel completed this stunt on November 19, 1974, at Moscow, Idaho, after modifying the motorcycle and attempting the jump three times.

Throughout his career, Knievel performed more than 75 motorcycle jumps, 60 parachute jumps, and 70 bungee jumps.
